page.title: 18Pilsley School
page.content: Pilsley Church of England (Aided) School was built in 1849 and extended and modernised in 1970. It is stone built and has two classrooms and a large hall used for school meals, physical education, television, and community meetings. The two classes are from ages four to seven and then seven to eleven years. There are two full-time teachers, one being the head, two part-time staff and two welfare assistants, one being the school clerk. The meals are cooked in the adjoining canteen and distributed by the cook and meal time supervisor. There are 38 children on roll, some who travel from surrounding areas. Most are children of employees of Chatsworth. The school is closely linked with St.Peter's Church, Edensor
